tool.name: mapMatch

param.name: in_track
param.dialogReference: Enter track file (shp) that needs to be map matched. It should contain point geometries ordered by time.May be unprojected (WGS84).

param.name: in_roads
param.dialogReference: Enter the road network file (shp), containing polylines, against which the track is matched. This file should be projected in a planar reference system, since the method computes Euclidean distances between points and network segments.

param.name: decayconstantNet
param.dialogReference: Enter the network distance (in meter) after which the match probability falls under 0.36 (exponential decay). This parameter depends on tracking frequency. Default is 30 meters.

param.name: decayconstantEu
param.displayname: Decay constant for Eucl. distances (in meter)
param.dialogReference: Enter the Euclidean distance (in meter) after which the match probability falls under 0.36 (exponential decay). This parameter depends on positional error. Default is 10 meters.

param.name: maxDist
param.displayname: maximum Eucl. distance for selecting segment candidates (in meter)
param.dialogReference: Enter the Euclidean distance threshold (in meter) for taking into account segment candidates on the network. Default is 50 meters.

tool.summary: This tool allows map matching (matching of track points to a network)in ArcGIS using a Hidden Markov model with probabilities parameterized based on spatial + network distances. Follows the ideas in Newson, Krumm (2009): "Hidden markov Map Matching through noise and sparseness"

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool allows map matching (matching of track points to a network)in ArcGIS using a Hidden Markov model with probabilities parameterized based on spatial + network distances. Follows the ideas in Newson, Krumm (2009): "Hidden markov Map Matching through noise and sparseness"
